questions: In terms of land area, is Bavaria greater than Bremen?
Does Bavaria have a larger land area than Bremen?
Comparing the sizes of German states, is Bavaria bigger than Bremen?
Would Bavaria occupy more area on a map than Bremen?
Looking at the size, is Bavaria larger than Bremen?
When comparing their areas, is Bavaria bigger than Bremen?
In comparison, is Bavaria larger in size than Bremen?
Which is bigger, Bavaria or Bremen?
Is there a bigger state than Bremen in Germany?
answers: Yes, Bavaria has a larger land area.
Yes, Bavaria would take up more space on a map.
Indeed, Bavaria is larger when looking at size.
In a comparison of areas, Bavaria would be bigger.
When compared, Bavaria is larger in size.
Between the two, Bavaria is bigger.
Yes, Bavaria is bigger than Bremen in terms of area.
context: 275px|thumb|States of Germany (in German) The Federal Republic of Germany (FRG) has 16 states (). The biggest is Bavaria and the smallest is Bremen. Most of them were created after the Second World War. Some states have historical roots from the early Middle Ages. State creation since 1949: * 1952: Three small states (Baden, Württemberg-Baden and Württemberg- Hohenzollern, part of Germany since 1949) joined to form Baden-Württemberg. * 1957: The Saar, which was put under French administration after World War II, joined the Federal Republic of Germany as the Saarland. * 1990: On German reunification, the reunited city of Berlin and the territory of the former German Democratic Republic joined the Federal Republic as six new states.
